alert.note: Alert for Mercer; Middlesex; Somerset; Western Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 11:53AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Mercer, southeastern Somerset, central Monmouth and Middlesex Counties through 1215 PM EDT... At 1152 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cranbury, or 13 miles northeast of Trenton, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New Brunswick, Somerset, Old Bridge, East Brunswick, South Brunswick, Sayreville, North Brunswick, Marlboro, Manalapan, Holmdel, Middlesex, Matawan, Jamesburg, Hightstown, Cranbury, Roosevelt, Brownville, Yorketown, Twin Rivers and Morganville. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 8A and 10. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 7 and 11. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 111 and 125. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
